briefTitle: Safety and Efficacy of Ziprasidone in Children and Adolescents With Bipolar I Disorder (Manic or Mixed)

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* DSM-IV criteria for Bipolar I disorder (manic or mixed); age 10 - 17 years

Exclusion Criteria:

* Imminent risk of suicide or homicide, as judged by the site investigator; any history of serious or unstable medical illness, including risk for QT prolongation

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in Young Mania Rating Scale (YMRS) Score at Week 4
outcomeMeasures.description: YMRS: an 11-item scale that measured the severity of manic episodes. Four items were rated on a scale from 0 (symptom absent) to 8 (symptom extremely severe). The remaining items were rated on a scale from 0 (symptom absent) to 4 (symptom extremely severe). YMRS total score ranged from 0 to 60, higher score indicated higher severity of mania.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in Young Mania Rating Scale (YMRS) Score at Week 1, 2 and 3
outcomeMeasures.description: YMRS: an 11-item scale that measured the severity of manic episodes. Four items were rated on a scale from 0 (symptom absent) to 8 (symptom extremely severe). The remaining items were rated on a scale from 0 (symptom absent) to 4 (symptom extremely severe). YMRS total score ranged from 0 to 60, higher score indicated higher severity of mania.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in Clinical Global Impression - Severity (CGI-S) Score at Week 1, 2, 3 and 4
outcomeMeasures.description: CGI-S: 7-point clinician rated scale to assess severity of participant's current illness state; range: 1 (normal - not ill at all) to 7 (among the most extremely ill).

outcomeMeasures.title: Clinical Global Impression - Improvement (CGI-I) Score
outcomeMeasures.description: CGI-I: 7-point clinician rated scale ranging from 1 (very much improved) to 7 (very much worse). Improvement is defined as a score of 1 (very much improved), 2 (much improved), or 3 (minimally improved) on the scale.
